result.execSummary:
The defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 12-31-2018. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court orders restitution set at $0.
First 6 months to be served STRAIGHT TIME. Second 6 months to include Huber release for work, medical treatment and mental health treatment. Credit for 51 days.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: - Court orders restitution in the amount of $172.99 awarded to Armani W.  Restitution to be paid first.  Cash bail to apply.

- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and restitution while on probation to convert to a civil judgment.
- If defendant serves time in the prison system, as to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- No contact with Armani W, Leroy P & Kevin A.

- Mental health assessment and any recommended treatments.  
- Court ordered defendant take all prescribed medications.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments.
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case in court for sentencing hearing on COUNT 2.  
State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 72 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 36 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.  

Court orders the following conditions of probation and extended supervision: 
 
- Serve 300 DAYS in the House of Correction with huber, CONSECUTIVE
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- mental health assessment and any recommended treatments.  Court ordered defendant take all prescribed medications.
- maintain work and/or school 
- 25 hours of community service
- no contact with Armani W, Leroy P & Kevin A

Court orders restitution in the amount of $172.99 awarded to Armani W.  Restitution to be paid first.  Cash bail to apply.
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and restitution while on probation to convert to a civil judgment.
If defendant serves time in the prison system, as to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,

for Armani W, received and filed

**CASE SPUN TO JUDGE CONEN, BR. #30, FROM JUDGE DEE, BR. 37**

Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with Attorney John C Glover.  Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea hearing.  The State filed an Amended Information, amending count #2 to Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, 941.30(2).  AS TO PLEA:  AS TO COUNT #2 (AS AMENDED):  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

The Court VACATED the December 4, 2017 Jury Trial.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter set for sentencing on February 1, 2018 at 1:30pm in Br. 37, Judge Dee's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Amending Count #2 to:  Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, received and filed.

undated from defendant, received and filed

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: 
Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 51 days time served.  
Court orders the first 6 MONTHS to be served STRAIGHT TIME; the second 6 MONTHS to include Huber release for WORK, MEDICAL TREATMENT and MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT.  
Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders those amounts to be paid by 12.31.18.  
Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Matter is in trial posture.  Trial dates selected with counsel.  
**All parties are notified that effective July 29, 2017, this case will be assigned to the Honorable Christopher Dee, Branch 37, in Room 632 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 09:30 am.

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: 
At the hour of 3:51pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court hears argument re: state's motion for judgment on the verdict and defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  State requests remand.  Court hears argument.  Court orders bail increased to $5000 CASH ($1500 CASH previously posted) with turn over to Justice Point with GPS monitoring.  All other terms and conditions of previously set bail to apply.  Court orders matter scheduled for motion hearing/decision as to motions for judgment on the verdict.  Matter is adjourned. Defendant taken into custody.  Oral ruling scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

AT TO COUNT 1 ONLY:

Jury out of box for break.  Closing arguments of defense countinues.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror (#9) selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:18pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Walls and Luty who were duly sworn for that purpose.

AT TO COUNT 1 ONLY: 
Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in court for continuation of jury trial from 5/15/17.  Court makes record re: status of case.  Defense motion for mistrial argued and DENIED by the Court.  Jury in box at 9:16am.  Trial continues.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Angela Juarez.  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court stands in recess for morning break.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Court holds colloquy with defendant re: right to testify.  Defendant to advise the Court as to his decision after testimony of next witness.  Court holds colloquy with next witness: Tamara S.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Tamara S.  Jury out of box.  Instruction conference held.  Court holds colloquy with defendant re: right to testify.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily WAIVES his right to testify.  Upon request of the State, Court receives Exhibit 4 in it's entirety.  Jury in box.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Jury is released for the lunch hour at 11:40am.  Trial to continue at 1:30pm.

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: 
Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court for continuation of jury trial.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Case is called on the record at 8:50am.  Court makes record re: video surveillance recently turned over by the state.  Court hears argument.  Defense requests trial be adjourned to allow for additional time to investigate.  Court passes case while jury panel is secured.  Case continues on the record.  Court makes record re: defense counsel's request to adjourn trial due to illness of defendant.  For reasons as set forth, Court orders trial to proceed.  Jury panel in court at 9:32am.  Jury selection continues.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury out of box.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Instruction conference held.  Jury in box, jurors sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Sergeant Michael Hayden.  Jury out of box for break.  Court hears argument re: testimony to be elicited by next witness.  Court stands in recess for morning break.  In-custody witness, Armani W., present in court.  Case continues on the record.  Court makes record and hears argument re: testimony to be elicited and prior convictions of next witness.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  Court conducts sidebar.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Court vacates body attachment once testimony is completed.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the State: Armani W.  Jury out of box at 11:20am due to defendant abruptly feeling ill.  Court orders trial recessed until pm session.  Jury is released for the lunch hour.

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: 
(AM) Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 9:21am.  Defense requests additional witness testify re: defense Miranda motion.  State objects.  Court reopens the record as to defense motion to suppress statement.  Sworn for defense: Tamara S.  Court places findings and ruling on the record.  For reasons as set forth, Court DENIES defense motion to suppress statement.  Court passes case, jury panel is not yet available.  Additionally, State has to address matter in another court.  

Case is recalled at 10:50am.  Parties are reassembled.  Court orders jury panel.  Defense makes record re: discovery.  Court hears argument.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:17am.  Court releases panel for the lunch hour at 11:50am.  Jury selection to continue at 1:30pm. 

(PM)  Same appearances.  Panel in Court at 3:10pm.  Voir dire continues.  Jury out of box for break.  Court makes record re: strikes for cause.  Jury panel in Court.  Court releases jury panel for the evening at 4:52pm.  State makes record re: defaulting witness, ARMANI W.  State indicates witness is currently in custody.  MCSO unable to verify custody status.  Also present in Court: Attorney Vincent Guimont.  Counsel represents witness on pending case assigned to Judge Cimpl.  Court hears argument.  For reasons as set forth, Court orders witness to remain in custody until testimony occurs.  Sidebar placed on the record.  Jury selection to resume on 5/11/17 at 8:30am in Br. 35.
body attachment issued forthwith as to defaulting witness, ARMANI W.

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:

State offers to relinquish peremptory strikes.  Defense objects.  Court hears argument.  Court stands in recess for afternoon break.  Court places ruling on the record re: peremptory challenges.  For reasons as set forth, Court orders panel struck.  New panel (30 jurors) is ordered for tomorrow morning.  Court to place Miranda ruling on the record tomorrow.  Court orders trial adjourned, trial to resume on 5/10/17 at 9:15am.

Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Zachary A Wittchow for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Bail/bond hearing held on the record.  Defense motion to modify GPS conditions is GRANTED by the Court.  Court allows defendant release to enroll in programming at MATC.  Defendant to have release for any appointments associated with enrollment and release to take placement test.  Defendant to provide verification (date and time) to Justice Point of any appointments and testing.  Once defendant is accepted into a program, Court authorizes release to attend school. Court finds that request is premature at this time.   Request may be considered once defendant has an address and names of residents at that location.  Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 5/8/17 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on State's request to adjourn trial due to family emergency.  Defense objects, Court hears argument.  Defense motion to change GPS conditions argued and granted by the Court.  Court orders defendant to have release for laundy 2 hours, every other week.  Court makes no change to release for child care, additional information from Family Court to be provided to the Court.  If Justice Point has additional recommendations, they can submit that in writing to the Court.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court grants State's request to adjourn trial.  Court orders 1/23/17 jury trial date is and rescheduled.  Earlier dates offered to counsel, defense is not available for dates offered in February and March.  No additonal final pretrial date is scheduled.  If parties are requesting earlier resolution date, they are to contact the Court for scheduling.  Jury trial scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ridge Dijon Fortune in court with attorney John c Glover.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Motion hearing held on the record.  Court hears argument re: defense motion to sever counts.  Court GRANTS defense motion to sever counts.  COUNT 1 TO BE TRIED SEPERATE FROM COUNT 2.
